basics.name: Ben Finkelshtein
basics.summary: PhD candidate at the University of Oxford under the supervision of Prof. Michael Bronstein and Dr. Ismail Ilkan Ceylan. With extensive experience in both academia and industry, I have worked on areas such as natural language processing, anomaly detection, and time series forecasting.

publications.name: Learning on Large Graphs using Intersecting Communities
publications.summary: A new and fundamentally different pipeline for learning on very large non-sparse graphs using intersecting communities.

publications.name: Graph Neural Network Outputs are Almost Surely Asymptotically Constant
publications.summary: A new angle on the expressive power of GNNs by studying  how the predictions of a GNN probabilistic classifier evolve.

publications.name: Cooperative Graph Neural Networks
publications.summary: A more dynamic and flexible message-passing paradigm in which each node can choose a different communication strategy.

publications.name: Strategic Classification with Graphs Neural Networks
publications.summary: Learning in a setting where users that are dependant can modify their features to obtain favorable predictions.

publications.name: A Simple and Universal Rotation Equivariant Point-cloud Network
publications.summary: A simple architecture which is equivariant to rigid motions with the ability to approximate any equivariant function.

publications.name: Single-Node Attack for Fooling Graph Neural Networks
publications.summary: Showcased that GNNs are vulnerable to a realistic single-node adversarial attack, even when the attacker cannot be chosen.

work.name: eBay
work.summary: Engineered NLP models to optimize search query relevance for landing pages, enhancing search engine optimization. Developed a keyword extraction technique integrated with GPT, resulting in a 30% increase in click-through rates within three months.

work.name: SKF Group, AI Center of Excellence
work.summary: Led research in event prediction, anomaly detection, and time series forecasting for machinery fault diagnosis at SKF. Designed and implemented machine learning pipelines and developed an event-based evaluation metric that boosted anomaly detection accuracy from 78% to 90%.

work.name: Rafael Advanced Defense Systems
work.summary: Developed a neural network to predict n-body problem solutions for astronomy or aerodynamics in a classified setting. Created physics-based simulations to enhance model comparison, improving prediction accuracy by 21%. Performed data processing and statistical analysis on confidential data, presenting findings in a detailed report and presentation.

teaching.name: University of Oxford, Faculty of Computer Science
teaching.summary: Head TA for Geometric Deep Learning and Graph Representation Learning courses, responsible over the other TAs, creating coding assignments and guiding 20 students through coursework.

teaching.name: Blue Education
teaching.summary: Taught Math, Physics, and Computer Science for A-Levels, SAT, and college exams as an online part-time tutor.

teaching.name: Technion - Israel Institute of Technology, Faculty of Computer Science
teaching.summary: Head TA for the Geometric Deep Learning course, supervising 40 students and developing tutorials and code notebooks for the course.
